einops 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Reduce operation for einops expressions

Source: R/reduce.R
reduce.Rd

Reduces tensor dimensions according to einops notation. This function applies a reduction function (like sum, mean, max) along specified dimensions while potentially reshaping the tensor according to the einops pattern.

Usage

reduce(x, expr, func, ...)

# S3 method for class 'array'
reduce(x, expr, func, ...)

Arguments

x

object to reduce (array, matrix, etc.)

expr

character string with einops expression (e.g., "h w c -> h w")

func

character string naming the reduction function (e.g., "sum", "mean", "max")

...

additional arguments passed to the reduction function

Value

reduced object with dimensions according to output pattern

Examples

# 2D reduction
arr <- array(1:12, dim = c(3, 4))
reduce(arr, "h w -> h", "sum")
#> Error in parse_einops(expr): could not find function "parse_einops"
reduce(arr, "h w -> w", "sum")
#> Error in parse_einops(expr): could not find function "parse_einops"
reduce(arr, "h w ->", "sum")
#> Error in parse_einops(expr): could not find function "parse_einops"

# 3D reduction with grouping
arr3d <- array(1:24, dim = c(2, 3, 4))
reduce(arr3d, "b h w -> h w", "sum")
#> Error in parse_einops(expr): could not find function "parse_einops"
reduce(arr3d, "(b h) w -> w", "sum")
#> Error in parse_einops(expr): could not find function "parse_einops"

# Using ellipsis
reduce(arr3d, "... w -> ...", "sum")
#> Error in parse_einops(expr): could not find function "parse_einops"
